    • Constructor Detail

      • Vector

        public Vector(java.util.Random random,
      com.google.common.collect.Range<java.lang.Double> bounds)
        Constructor to create random parameters in the vector. The fitness value is set to infinite since it still needs to be calculated.
        Parameters:
        random - The random number object.
        bounds - The bounds of the vector.

      • Vector

        public Vector(com.google.common.collect.Range<java.lang.Double> bounds)
        Default constructor for a vector. Sets the fitness value to infinity.
        Parameters:
        bounds - The bounds for the vector.

      • setParameter

        public void setParameter(int index,
                java.lang.Double parameter)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the parameter to the given value, if this value is outside of the vector's defined bounds the parameter will equal the bound which it exceeded.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the parameter to set.
        parameter - The new parameter to change the previous one to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • size

        public int size()
        Get the size of the parameters list.
        Returns:
        The size.

      • getBounds

        public com.google.common.collect.Range<java.lang.Double> getBounds()
        Get the bounds of the vector.
        Returns:
        The bounds of the given vector.

      • addParameter

        public void addParameter(java.lang.Double parameter)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Add a parameter to the end of the list, increasing the size by 1. If the parameter is outside the vector's defined bounds then it will be set to the bound that it exceeded.
        Parameters:
        parameter - The new parameter.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
